Name: Banking Law
Description: Law that governs how banks and other financial institutions conduct business.

Name: Banking Operations
Description: Law governing routine banking operations including bank capital requirements, risk management, etc.

Name: Bank Secrecy and Anti-Money Laundering
Description: Law regulating financial institutions relating to money laundering.

Name: Bankruptcy and Restructuring
Description: Laws relating to insolvent individuals and companies.

Name: Corporate Insolvency
Description: Law relating to insolvency of corporations.

Name: Personal Insolvency
Description: Law relating to debt relief for individuals.

Name: Constitutional and Civil Rights
Description: Rights that protect individuals' freedom from infringement by governments, social organizations, and private individuals.

Name: Discrimination
Description: Protection from discrimination on grounds such as race, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, color, age, political affiliation, ethnicity, religion, and disability.

Name: Individual
Description: Individual rights such as privacy and the freedom of thought, speech, religion, press, assembly, and movement.

Name: Political
Description: Political rights include natural justice (procedural fairness) in law, such as the rights of the accused, including the right to a fair trial; due process; the right to seek redress or a legal remedy; and rights of participation in civil society and politics such as freedom of association, the right to assemble, the right to petition, the right of self-defense, and the right to vote.

Name: Corporate Law
Description: Law that governs the formation and operation of corporations.

Name: Business Organizations
Description: Law governing the creation and operation of businesses.

Name: Corporate Governance
Description: Mechanisms, processes, and relations by which corporations are controlled and operated.

Name: Mergers and Acquisitions
Description: Law dealing with companies that are purchasing and/or merging with other companies.

Name: Commercial and Trade Law
Description: Law that applies to the rights, relations, and conduct of persons and businesses engaged in commerce, merchandising, trade, and sales.

Name: Admiralty and Maritime Law
Description: Law that governs nautical issues and private maritime disputes.

Name: Antitrust and Competition
Description: Law surrounding business competition.

Name: Consumer Protection
Description: Law that creates a more equitable balance for buyers in the marketplace and prevents sellers from using dishonest tactics.

Name: Trade Law
Description: Law, rules, and customs governing trade between countries including imports and exports.

Name: Commercial Transactions
Description: Law related to business contracts and agreements.

Name: Criminal Law
Description: Law concerned with the punishment of individuals who commit crimes.

Name: Anti-Corruption
Description: Law addressing bribery of public officials.

Name: Asset Forfeiture
Description: Asset forfeiture or asset seizure is a form of confiscation of assets by the state.

Name: Business and Financial Crimes
Description: Fraud, embezzlement, ponzi, etc. False Claims Act.

Name: Cybercrime
Description: Crimes committed using a computer or directed at computers, data, or other information technology - piracy, hacking, etc.

Name: Organized Crime
Description: Law related to curtailing organized crime.

Name: Education Law
Description: The body of state and federal law that covers teachers, schools, school districts, school boards, and the students they teach.

Name: Energy Law
Description: Law concerned with creating, enforcing and challenging laws that regulate energy use.

Name: Nuclear
Description: Law regulating nuclear power and nuclear materials.

Name: Oil and Gas
Description: Law pertaining to the acquisition and ownership rights in oil and gas both under the soil before discovery and after its capture, and adjudication regarding those rights.

Name: Renewable Energy
Description: Laws pertaining to renewable energy.

Name: Hydroelectric Energy Law
Description: Laws pertaining to hydroelectric power.

Name: Solar Energy Law
Description: Laws pertaining to solar power.

Name: Wind Power Law
Description: Law pertaining to wind power.

Name: Sales and Transmission
Description: Law involving all aspects of the economic regulation of energy utilities including electric utilities, power generation and electric transmission, distribution of electricity, natural gas, crude and petroleum, and coal.

Name: Environmental and Natural Resource Law
Description: Law addressing environmental pollution and natural resource management.

Name: Air Quality
Description: Law governing the emission of air pollutants into the atmosphere.

Name: Contaminant Cleanup
Description: Law governing the removal of pollution or contaminants from environmental media such as soil, sediment, surface water, or groundwater.

Name: Chemical Safety
Description: Law governing the use of chemicals in human activities, particularly man-made chemicals in modern industrial applications.

Name: Impact Assessment
Description: Assessment of the environmental consequences (positive and negative) of a plan, policy, program, or actual projects prior to the decision to move forward with the proposed action.

Name: Forest Resources
Description: Laws governing activities in designated forest lands, most commonly with respect to forest management and timber harvesting.

Name: Fish and Game
Description: Laws regulating the right to pursue and take or kill certain kinds of fish and wild animal (game).

Name: Mineral Resources
Description: Laws covering the ownership of the mineral resource and who can work them.

Name: Water Quality
Description: Law governing the release of pollutants into water resources.

Name: Water Resources and Wetlands
Description: Laws governing the ownership and use of water resources, including surface water and groundwater, oceans and seas.

Name: Wildlife and Plants
Description: Laws governing the potential impact of human activity on wild animals or plants, whether directly on individuals or populations, or indirectly via habitat degradation.

Name: Waste Management
Description: Law governing the transport, treatment, storage, and disposal of all manner of waste, including municipal solid waste, hazardous waste, and nuclear waste.

Name: Finance and Lending
Description: Law supporting the function of providing loans or other financing to businesses or individuals.

Name: Commercial Finance
Description: Law supporting the function of providing loans or other financing to businesses.

Name: Lender Liability
Description: Law which holds lender liable for a borrower's financial losses that are directly or indirectly related to the lender's actions.

Name: Food and Drug Law
Description: Laws regulating food, drugs, and cosmetics.

Name: Gaming Law
Description: Law, rules, and regulations that apply to the gaming or gambling industry.

Name: Health Law
Description: Law, rules, regulations and other jurisprudence among providers, payers and vendors to the health care industry and its patients; and (2) delivery of health care services; all with an emphasis on operations, regulatory and transactional legal issues.

Name: Information Security Law
Description: Law regulating the protection of information and information systems from unauthorized access

Name: Cybersecurity
Description: Law and rules related to the protection of information and information systems.

Name: Government Access and Disclosure
Description: Law relating to the access and disclosure of information by a government.

Name: Privacy
Description: Laws regulating the storing, and using of personally identifiable information of individuals.

Name: Insurance Law
Description: Law surrounding insurance, including insurance policies and claims.

Name: Intellectual Property Law
Description: Law protecting the legal rights to inventions, designs, and artistic works.

Name: Copyright Law
Description: Laws intended to encourage the creation of art and culture by rewarding authors and artists with a set of exclusive rights.

Name: Patent Law
Description: Law is designed to encourage inventors to disclose their new technology to the world by offering the incentive of a limited-time monopoly on the technology.

Name: Trademark and Trade Dress Law
Description: Law protecting a business' commercial identity or brand by or product design discouraging other businesses from adopting a name, logo or design that is "confusingly similar" to an existing trademark or design.

Name: Trade Secret Law
Description: Law relating to trade secrets.

Name: Labor and Employment Law
Description: Law relating to the relationship between trade individuals, unions, employers and the government.

Name: Employment Discrimination
Description: Law relating to protected class employment discrimination including retaliation and harassment

Name: Employment Health and Safety
Description: Law governing the health and safety of employees.

Name: Employment Immigration
Description: National statutes, and regulations governing employment-based immigration into and deportation from a country.

Name: Labor Law
Description: Law relating to the relationship between trade unions, employers and the government.

Name: Pension and Benefits Law
Description: Law relating to retirement and welfare benefit plans, with particular emphasis on benefits arrangements.

Name: Unemployment Benefits
Description: Unemployment benefits refer to those benefits given by the government to unemployed persons.

Name: Wage and Hour Law
Description: Law that governs the wages rates an employer can pay its employees, the hours for which an employer must compensate its employees, child labor laws and meal and break laws.

Name: Workers Compensation Law
Description: Law addressing wage replacement and medical benefits to employees injured in the course of employment.

Name: Termination
Description: Law encompassing rules by which an employer may terminate an employee.

Name: Personal and Family Law
Description: Law that deals with family matters and domestic relations.

Name: Adoption, Surrogacy and Paternity
Description: Laws relating to adoption, surrogacy and paternity.

Name: Immigration Law
Description: National statutes, and regulations governing immigration into and deportation from a country including issues of naturalization and citizenship.

Name: Juvenile Law
Description: Juvenile law and child protective proceedings.

Name: Matrimonial
Description: Laws relating to marriage, civil unions, and domestic partnerships.

Name: Public and Administrative Law
Description: Law which governs relationships between individuals and the government, and the activities of administrative agencies of government including rule making, adjudication, or the enforcement of a specific regulatory agenda.

Name: Electon Law
Description: Legal procedures and regulations governing elections.

Name: Government Contracts
Description: Laws relating to contracts in which the government is a party.

Name: Indiginous People's Law
Description: Legal procedures and regulations specific to indigenous peoples' rights.

Name: Military and Veterans Law
Description: Legal procedures and regulations specific to the military and veterans rights.

Name: Public Finance
Description: Law including legislation and regulations relating to the financial activities of government or public sector organizations.

Name: Public Policy and Government Affairs
Description: Rules surrounding lobbying and political advocacy.

Name: Project Finance Law
Description: Legal procedures and regulations specific to the development, equity and non-recourse debt financing, construction, operation, and maintenance of major industrial and infrastructure projects.

Name: Public Health and Welfare
Description: Law relating to the authority of the government at various jurisdictional levels to improve the health of the general population within societal limits and norms.

Name: Real Property Law
Description: Law that governs the various forms of ownership and tenancy in real property.

Name: Construction and Development
Description: Law dealing with matters relating to building construction, engineering, and related fields.

Name: Eminent Domain Law
Description: Law regulating the taking of private land for public use.

Name: Landlord Tenant Law
Description: Law that details the rights and duties of landlords and tenants

Name: Land Use and Zoning Law
Description: Law regulating the subdivision, use, and restriction of land.

Name: Property Rights and Transactions
Description: Law relating to the acquisition and transfer of real property.

Name: Securities and Financial Instruments Law
Description: Law covering transactions and other dealings with securities including both federal- and state-level regulation by purely governmental regulatory agencies, listing requirements of exchanges, and rules of self-regulatory organizations.

Name: Broker-Dealer
Description: Law surrounding individuals engaged in effecting transactions in securities for others or for their own account.

Name: Commodities
Description: Law governing commodities and futures trading activities.

Name: Derivatives and Futures
Description: Law governing derivatives.

Name: Exchanges
Description: Rules regarding market places or facilities for bringing together purchasers and sellers of securities.

Name: Investment Advisor
Description: Rules regarding investment adviser duties and responsibilities.

Name: Investment Companies
Description: Regulations on companies that engage primarily in investing, reinvesting, and trading in securities, and whose own securities are offered to the investing public.

Name: Security Offerings and Capital Markets
Description: Corporate debt and equity issuance (public and private) and markets.

Name: Structured Finance
Description: Law surrounding securitization and asset-backed securities.

Name: Tax and Revenue Law
Description: Law which deals with the constitutional, common-law, statutory, tax treaty, and regulatory rules that constitute the law applicable to taxation.

Name: Estates, Gifts, and Trusts
Description: Laws regulating estate or personal planning and administration.

Name: Non-Profit and Exempt Organizations
Description: Laws that govern non-profit and charitable organizations operations and management.

Name: Tax
Description: Federal, State, and Local tax laws.

Name: Telecommunications Law
Description: Laws regulating telecommunications and broadcasting.

Name: Telecommunication Utilites
Description: Laws regulating telecommunications and broadcasting utilities.

Name: Personal Injury and Torts
Description: Law which allows an injured person to obtain compensation from the person who caused the injury.

Name: Assault
Description: Law relating to inflicting physical harm or unwanted physical contact upon a person or a threat or attempt to commit such an action.

Name: Defamation
Description: The action of damaging the good reputation of someone; slander or libel.

Name: Fraud and Economic Torts
Description: The wrong done by another person or business that occurs in, or affects, commerce.

Name: Negligence and Malpractice
Description: Failure to exercise the care that a reasonably prudent person or professional, in the case of professional negligence, would exercise in like circumstances and the harm caused by those actions.

Name: Product Liability
Description: Law relating to liability for injuries caused by defective or unsafe products.

Name: Transportation Law
Description: Law involving transportation infrastructure and all forms of road, railway, water and air transport.

Name: Aviation Law
Description: Law that concerns flight, air travel, and associated legal and business concerns.

Name: Motor Vehicle Law
Description: Law covering all the aspects of registering and titling motor vehicles, and licensing drivers.

Name: Railway Law
Description: Law that concerns railways and associated legal and business concerns.
